name: EEPROM Data File
summary: Learn about .EEP files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: EEP files are commonly used for storing save states of games in Project64, a Nintendo 64 emulator. If the EEP file is created by Project64, it will be saved in the Project64\â€‹Save folder by default.
NOTE: EEP files can also be edited with a Hex editor or a programming application like PonyProg.

description: An EEP file is a data file that stores information on EEPROM (Electrically Erasable Programmable Read-Only Memory) media, such as flash memory. It contains data in a hexadecimal ("hex") format, which defines the contents of the memory device.
